BrainJarInteraction01.synopsis: The player connects to a brainjar that's controlling a steel watcher somewhere in the city, wielding their power over life and death.The Dwarf fugitive is an offstage speaker, he is not meant to be visible in the dialog, you just hear his voice.

FundangoTitanWarning.synopsis: Fundango warns the player about the impending fight with the Titan.
FundangoTitanWarning.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen reconuse "oe LOW_Foundry_FundangoFollower"Teleport to -1962; 0; 205

AD_BrainJarCallout02.synopsis: A brain jar's "radio chatter" can be psionically overheard by players passing by.
AD_BrainJarCallout02.how_to_trigger: load up CTY_Main_Ago to -2007; -2; 211walk forwardwait for the AD to come up (will need previous ADs to finish)

AD_ToobinNearSwitchBoard.synopsis: Toobin stands by the Neurocitor, calling the player's attention.
AD_ToobinNearSwitchBoard.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen ReCon and use "oe low_foundry_fundangofollower"go to -1981; -6; 206walk into the boss room and defeat the enemieswait for Toobin to walk to his position by the Neurocitorobserve the AD paly

Explosion.synopsis: The steel watch foundry explodes, and the players escape by the skin of their teeth.
Explosion.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen ReConuse oe LOW_GiveBombGo to -1935; -7; 206Kill mindflayerInteract with S_LOW_Control_Computer_db465637-8fe5-435d-adc0-34528f47a724choose to place the bomb

AD_TitanCombatlines.synopsis: The Titan's combat ADs during the Foundry boss fight. He's the ultmate watcher. Tagging with SFX in case anything special could be added to his voice to make him sound extra scary and mechanical.
AD_TitanCombatlines.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_AGo to -1970; -7; 206open the door in front of you and enter the roomstart the fight with the watchers and observe the ADs from the Titan watcher

BrainJarInteraction02.synopsis: The player connects to a brainjar that's controlling a steel watcher somewhere in the city, wielding their power over life and death.

SwitchBoard.synopsis: The player interacts with the neural switchboard and attempts to trigger an explosion.
SwitchBoard.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aopen ReConuse "oe LOW_GiveBomb"Go to -1936; -7; 204kill the mindflayerInteract with S_LOW_NeuralSwitchboard_b8d9d7e5-dd97-4946-83e3-66ae22cd7a81 Choose to place the bomb

AD_AutomatonHead.synopsis: The player finds an automaton head that they might have encountered back in the underdark.
AD_AutomatonHead.how_to_trigger: Load up CTY_Main_Aturn on peace mode in ReconGo to -1954; -1; 186click on S_LOW_AutomatonComponent_Clickable_59ec4b0f-8dde-4739-ace5-c6286bd7743d

AD_BrainJarCallout03.synopsis: A brain jar's "radio chatter" can be psionically overheard by players passing by.
AD_BrainJarCallout03.how_to_trigger: load up CTY_Main_Ago to -2007; -2; 211walk forwardwait for the AD to come up (will need previous ADs to finish)

AD_BrainJar09_Narrator.synopsis: The player connects to a steel watcher's brain for a fleeting moment. This is a Narrator AD, so there is nothing important to see.

AD_BrainJar11_Narrator.synopsis: The player connects to a steel watcher's brain for a fleeting moment. This is a Narrator AD, so there is nothing important to see.

AD_BrainJarCallout.synopsis: A brain jar's "radio chatter" can be psionical overheard by players passing by.
AD_BrainJarCallout.how_to_trigger: load up CTY_Main_Ago to -2007; -2; 211walk forwardobserve the brain jar on the wall speak the AD

AD_BrainJar06_Narrator.synopsis: The player connects to a steel watcher's brain for a fleeting moment. This is a Narrator AD, so there is nothing important to see.

BrainJarInteraction03.synopsis: The player connects to a brainjar that's controlling a steel watcher somewhere in the city, wielding their power over life and death.

BrainJarInteraction01_12.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_12.text: *The parasite does not respond, so focused is it on the directing the Steel Watcher.*

BrainJarInteraction01_24.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_24.text: *The liquid that coats the brain is thick, almost gel-like - it is like nothing you have ever seen.*

BrainJarInteraction01_26.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_26.text: *Your mind whirls as the brain, swimming with parasitic juices, connects with yours.*

BrainJarInteraction01_4.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_4.text: *With a jerk, your mind is transported. You look down, your body of pure steel and power whirring. A dwarf cowers before you.*

BrainJarInteraction01_28.speaker: Dwarf Fugitive
BrainJarInteraction01_28.text: Please, Mr Steel Watcher, sir, I'll never steal again, I swear it on my mum's life. Just let me go!

BrainJarInteraction01_13.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction01_13.text: Attempt to wrest control of the Watcher and spare the dwarf.

BrainJarInteraction01_1.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_1.text: *You take control, but it is a struggle - your body freezes as the parasite fights back.*

BrainJarInteraction01_11.speaker: Dwarf Fugitive
BrainJarInteraction01_11.text: So - so I can go? Thank you, Mr Steel Watcher. Thank you!

BrainJarInteraction01_7.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_7.text: *You are kicked from the Watcher's as the dwarf flees - unaware how close he came to death.*

BrainJarInteraction01_6.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_6.text: *You struggle against the parasite, but can only watch as you raise a mighty leg.*

BrainJarInteraction01_29.speaker: Dwarf Fugitive
BrainJarInteraction01_29.text: What are you doing? NO, PLEASE!

BrainJarInteraction01_9.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_9.text: *You stomp on the dwarf, bones and intestines splashing on you.*

BrainJarInteraction01_18.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction01_18.text: Force the Steel Watcher to release the dwarf.

BrainJarInteraction01_10.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction01_10.text: Force the Steel Watcher to release the dwarf.

BrainJarInteraction01_25.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_25.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. You can only watch as the Steel Watcher raises its leg.*

BrainJarInteraction01_20.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_20.text: *The last thing you hear before you disconnect is the dwarf screaming - and the squelch of flesh beneath metal.*

BrainJarInteraction01_19.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction01_19.text: Make an example of him, and a spectacle for the public.

BrainJarInteraction01_8.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_8.text: *Clobbered right in the middle of the market square. What a dashing piece of brutality!*

BrainJarInteraction01_22.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction01_22.text: *You are kicked from the Watcher as it drives a fist through the dwarf, ripping his spinal cord out with ease.*

FundangoTitanWarning_16.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoTitanWarning_16.text: Wait. Elevated gyroscopes, triple-set quadropecs. No - it can't be.
FundangoTitanWarning_16.context: NodeContext: Stops dead on wait as he cocks his head, listening intently. Lines in italics are rapid fire. Then horrified at end

FundangoTitanWarning_20.speaker: Player
FundangoTitanWarning_20.text: Move - we don't have time for this.

FundangoTitanWarning_14.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoTitanWarning_14.text: You don't understand what lies ahead!

FundangoTitanWarning_13.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoTitanWarning_13.text: I hear it through the floor - powerful. Indestructible. The ultimate Watcher - the Titan.
FundangoTitanWarning_13.context: NodeContext: fear but also awestruck - he realises how amazing this is to have built

FundangoTitanWarning_6.speaker: Lae'zel
FundangoTitanWarning_6.text: Indestructible? I'll reduce it to scrap metal before the day is done.

FundangoTitanWarning_10.speaker: Shadowheart
FundangoTitanWarning_10.text: Another battle. Just what I needed.

FundangoTitanWarning_17.speaker: Astarion
FundangoTitanWarning_17.text: Of course they built an indestructible super-Watcher. Why wouldn't they?

FundangoTitanWarning_11.speaker: Gale
FundangoTitanWarning_11.text: An over-confident appraisal. I'll show them the flaws in their design.

FundangoTitanWarning_19.speaker: Halsin
FundangoTitanWarning_19.text: Fear not. Nothing is indestructible when nature's full fury is unleashed.

FundangoTitanWarning_1.speaker: Jaheira
FundangoTitanWarning_1.text: Bah. Every tinkerer thinks his toy is indestructible - until you hit it hard enough.

FundangoTitanWarning_2.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoTitanWarning_2.text: It shames me to admit this, but you must face this beast of Gondian folly alone - I would be crushed in an instant.

FundangoTitanWarning_21.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoTitanWarning_21.text: When it raises its shields, strike it with every scrap of magic and might you possess - and pray to Gond that it does not fire upon you. Good luck, my friend.

FundangoTitanWarning_18.speaker: Minsc
FundangoTitanWarning_18.text: The Watcher tightens what? Whatever it be, Minsc will knock it loose.
FundangoTitanWarning_18.context: NodeContext: a bad bad pun where Minsc misunderstands the threat of the Watcher Titan

FundangoTitanWarning_3.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
FundangoTitanWarning_3.text: Did you help to construct this metal monstrosity, gnome? Help us disable it.

FundangoTitanWarning_9.speaker: Player
FundangoTitanWarning_9.text: We're so close to the end - don't lose hope now.

FundangoTitanWarning_15.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
FundangoTitanWarning_15.text: Hope will not help us here, my friend.

AD_BrainJarCallout02_0.speaker: Brain Jar
AD_BrainJarCallout02_0.text: Disturbance at Wyrm's Crossing. Engaging now.

AD_ToobinNearSwitchBoard_0.speaker: Gondian Zanner Toobin
AD_ToobinNearSwitchBoard_0.text: It is time - let us end this.

Explosion_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reacts to ticking bomb, looks around nervously before running off screen to get to safety

Explosion_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players party bursts through the doors of the Foundry. They turn and see an explosion as the Foundry collapse - they escaped just in time.

AD_TitanCombatlines_0.speaker: Steel Watcher Titan
AD_TitanCombatlines_0.text: You are the architect of your own demise.

AD_TitanCombatlines_1.speaker: Steel Watcher Titan
AD_TitanCombatlines_1.text: The Steel Watch will be in every city, on every street in the Forgotten Realms. It is inevitable.

AD_TitanCombatlines_2.speaker: Steel Watcher Titan
AD_TitanCombatlines_2.text: The Steel Watch is progress. It is the future - you cannot stop it.

AD_TitanCombatlines_3.speaker: Steel Watcher Titan
AD_TitanCombatlines_3.text: Resistance is futile. Your death is inevitable.

BrainJarInteraction02_2.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_2.text: *You see the familiar sights of Wyrm's Crossing before the parasite shuts down the connection.*

BrainJarInteraction02_22.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_22.text: *Your tadpole eagerly responds to the parasite in the brain jar. You blink, to find yourself standing at Wyrm's Crossing.*

BrainJarInteraction02_19.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_19.text: *You are a Steel Watcher, a guardian of Baldur's Gate - before you stands a group of humans.*

BrainJarInteraction02_7.speaker: Human Mother
BrainJarInteraction02_7.text: He said he was Flaming Fist - that we had to empty our pockets if we wanted to enter the city. We didn't know it was a scam!

BrainJarInteraction02_24.speaker: Human Mother
BrainJarInteraction02_24.text: We have nothing left, and my kids are half-starved. Please, let us into the city - we have nowhere else to go.

BrainJarInteraction02_14.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction02_14.text: Step to one side to let the family pass.

BrainJarInteraction02_29.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_29.text: *Your gears whine in protest, but you force your body to one side - gesturing for the family to enter the city.*

BrainJarInteraction02_17.speaker: Human Mother
BrainJarInteraction02_17.text: Thank you, saer. Come on, kids - grab your bags. Hurry!

BrainJarInteraction02_31.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_31.text: *You are kicked from the Watcher's brain. The family runs into Baldur's Gate, unnoticed by the parasite.*

BrainJarInteraction02_5.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_5.text: *You are a mouse to an elephant, so overwhelming is the parasite's power.*

BrainJarInteraction02_15.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_15.text: *You reach behind you, but the family runs before you can draw your sword - fleeing towards the Risen Road.*

BrainJarInteraction02_18.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction02_18.text: Wrest control from the parasite and allow the family to pass.

BrainJarInteraction02_1.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction02_1.text: Wrest control from the parasite and allow the family to pass.

BrainJarInteraction02_26.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_26.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. You can only watch as you reach for your sword.*

BrainJarInteraction02_12.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_12.text: *The family flees before you can draw it - heading for the Risen Road and, mostly likely, their deaths.*

BrainJarInteraction02_32.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction02_32.text: HEY! STUPID PARASITE! LEAVE THEM ALONE.

BrainJarInteraction02_16.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_16.text: *Your words are snatched away in the tempest of the parasite's power as it activates the Steel Watcher.*

BrainJarInteraction02_30.speaker: Human Mother
BrainJarInteraction02_30.text: What - what are you doing? Kids, run! GO!

BrainJarInteraction02_4.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_4.text: *Her screams for help as the Watcher draws its sword are the last thing you hear.*

BrainJarInteraction02_3.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction02_3.text: Ready the Watcher's sword. One fewer mouth should make her life a breeze.

BrainJarInteraction02_8.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_8.text: *Of course she darts in front of the attack. Silly woman, letting yourself die will only doom your herd.*

BrainJarInteraction02_10.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_10.text: *You are kicked from the Watcher's brain as your sword cleaves the woman's head from her shoulders, coating her screaming children in blood.*

BrainJarInteraction02_23.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction02_23.text: *You catch something squirming in the shadows of the container, but then it is gone.*

SwitchBoard_11.speaker: Narrator
SwitchBoard_11.text: *The Neurocitor is a mix of Gondian ingenuity and illithid cruelty.*

SwitchBoard_25.speaker: Player
SwitchBoard_25.text: Recall the code Toobin shared with you.

SwitchBoard_17.speaker: Narrator
SwitchBoard_17.text: *Successfully inputting this will destroy the foundry - wiping it from the face of the Forgotten Realms.*

SwitchBoard_28.speaker: Player
SwitchBoard_28.text: Input code 'Nebelun', and increase the Neurocitor's output to maximum.

SwitchBoard_3.speaker: Neural Switchboard
SwitchBoard_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: shot over players shoulders of them doing something to the switchboard

SwitchBoard_10.speaker: Narrator
SwitchBoard_10.text: *You fumble the input code - locking yourself out of the Neurocitor.*

SwitchBoard_22.speaker: Player
SwitchBoard_22.text: Amidst unfamiliar script you see Gnomish. Use it to decipher the other symbols.

SwitchBoard_24.speaker: Player
SwitchBoard_24.text: Call upon your knowledge of ancient scripts to decipher the symbols.

SwitchBoard_16.speaker: Narrator
SwitchBoard_16.text: *The Neurocitor is the epicentre of the Steel Watch, controlling and connecting every single Watcher in the city.*

SwitchBoard_2.speaker: Narrator
SwitchBoard_2.text: *Its technology is far beyond anything you have ever seen - you will need more than magic or steel to destroy it.*

SwitchBoard_1.speaker: Narrator
SwitchBoard_1.text: *You cannot make sense of this complex machine.*

SwitchBoard_7.speaker: Player
SwitchBoard_7.text: Focus on the centre of the Neurocitor - the perfect place for the runepowder bomb.

SwitchBoard_21.speaker: Narrator
SwitchBoard_21.text: *This will destroy the foundry - wiping it from the face of the Forgotten Realms.*

SwitchBoard_14.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player carefully places the rune powder bomb on the neurocitor.

AD_AutomatonHead_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_AutomatonHead_0.text: *This head belonged to the automaton you encountered in the Underdark. How did it come to be here?*

AD_AutomatonHead_1.speaker: Narrator
AD_AutomatonHead_1.text: *This peculiar head is part of an automaton, but it doesn't resemble any Steel Watcher you've encountered.*

AD_BrainJar09_Narrator_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_BrainJar09_Narrator_0.text: *The Watcher this brain controls is offline for maintenance. The brain dreams, images of life in a garden cottage in spring.*

AD_BrainJar11_Narrator_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_BrainJar11_Narrator_0.text: *The brain in this jar is aware that its Watcher is on duty in the Control Centre, vast and throbbing with illithid telepathy. It ignores your mind touch as a mere distraction.*

AD_BrainJar06_Narrator_0.speaker: Narrator
AD_BrainJar06_Narrator_0.text: *The brain in this jar is controlling a Watcher on sentry duty at Wyrm's Rock. It patrols back and forth, vigilant for trouble.*

BrainJarInteraction03_6.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_6.text: *A parasite stirs within the pickled brain, twitching. As your mind connects, you feel yourself become strong, powerful - metal.*

BrainJarInteraction03_8.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_8.text: *You are a Steel Watcher charging through the streets in pursuit of a young girl. She is screaming.*

BrainJarInteraction03_23.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction03_23.text: Try to trip the Steel Watcher.

BrainJarInteraction03_17.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_17.text: *For the split second you wrest control the Steel Watcher's legs lock. It crashes to the ground.*

BrainJarInteraction03_5.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_5.text: *The little girl disappears down an alley - safe, for now.*

BrainJarInteraction03_7.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_7.text: *The parasite is too strong, and you can only watch as the little girl rounds a corner - to find a dead end.*

BrainJarInteraction03_20.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_20.text: *She cries for her mother as you draw your lance - raising it above your head.*

BrainJarInteraction03_16.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_16.text: *You are kicked from the infected brain as the lance comes down.*

BrainJarInteraction03_10.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction03_10.text: Disrupt the parasite's connection to the Steel Watcher.

BrainJarInteraction03_13.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction03_13.text: Disrupt the parasite's connection to the Steel Watcher.

BrainJarInteraction03_18.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_18.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. You can only watch as the little girl rounds a corner - to find a dead end.*

BrainJarInteraction03_25.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_25.text: *The child rounds a corner - to find a dead end. She turns to face you - tears streaming down her face. She is no more than seven years of age.*

BrainJarInteraction03_0.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_0.text: *The child rounds the corner to find a dead end. Her cries for her mother echo in your mind as you are pulled back to your body.*

BrainJarInteraction03_21.speaker: Player
BrainJarInteraction03_21.text: Plough her over. A warhorse's purpose is to charge.

BrainJarInteraction03_26.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_26.text: *Like they always do at that troubled age, she shrieks for her mother as you corner her in a dingy alley.*

BrainJarInteraction03_24.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_24.text: *As you are thrown from the infected brain, you get one last glimpse of the girl. Just another stain in this filthy city.*

BrainJarInteraction03_12.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_12.text: *You catch a glimpse of busy street through the Watcher's eyes, but that is all.*

BrainJarInteraction03_22.speaker: Narrator
BrainJarInteraction03_22.text: *The brain twitches and pulses - as if still living.*
